Media.description: A photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content may be inline or provided by direct reference.

identifier.description: Identifiers associated with the image - these may include identifiers for the image itself, identifiers for the context of its collection (e.g. series ids) and context ids such as accession numbers or other workflow identifiers.

basedOn.description: A procedure that is fulfilled in whole or in part by the creation of this media.

partOf.description: A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step.

type.description: A code that classifies whether the media is an image, video or audio recording or some other media category.

modality.description: Details of the type of the media - usually, how it was acquired (what type of device). If images sourced from a DICOM system, are wrapped in a Media resource, then this is the modality.

view.description: The name of the imaging view e.g. Lateral or Antero-posterior (AP).

subject.description: Who/What this Media is a record of.

encounter.description: The encounter that establishes the context for this media.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time(s) at which the media was collected.

createdPeriod.description: The date and time(s) at which the media was collected.

issued.description: The date and time this version of the media was made available to providers, typically after having been reviewed.

operator.description: The person who administered the collection of the image.

reasonCode.description: Describes why the event occurred in coded or textual form.

bodySite.description: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).

deviceName.description: The name of the device / manufacturer of the device  that was used to make the recording.

device.description: The device used to collect the media.

height.description: Height of the image in pixels (photo/video).

width.description: Width of the image in pixels (photo/video).

frames.description: The number of frames in a photo. This is used with a multi-page fax, or an imaging acquisition context that takes multiple slices in a single image, or an animated gif. If there is more than one frame, this SHALL have a value in order to alert interface software that a multi-frame capable rendering widget is required.

duration.description: The duration of the recording in seconds - for audio and video.

content.description: The actual content of the media - inline or by direct reference to the media source file.

note.description: Comments made about the media by the performer, subject or other participants.
